_description: The Pageant of the Weavers, the Coventry Corpus Christi Play

CovArc112.First Lines:
[Y]E grett astronemars now awakeWith youre famus fatheres of
                    felosefy…
CovArc112.Last Lines:
…And of youre cumpany I wold you praAnd here I take my leve at
                    eyuere mon
CovArc112.Attributed Title:
Tys matter nevly translate be Robert Croo in the yere of oure Lord God
                        Mlvcxxxiiijte then beyng meyre Mastur Palmar beddar and Rychard
                    Smythe an[d Herre] Pyxley masturs of the weywars; thys boke yendide the seycond
                    day of Marche in yere above seyde (f. 17)

CovArc111.First Lines:
Ye gret astronemarris now awake With youre famus fadurs of
                    phelossefee…
CovArc111.Last Lines:
…Wyche wyll appere ondowtudli When thatt Lord the tyme doth
                    send…
CovArc111.Note:
A second copy on two loose fragmentary leaves, now with separate shelf
                    number; equivalent to lines 1-58 and 182-233.
